capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm telling you, those Hunters' teeth are definitely Hagrid's. I've seen him with them before, and he's always been very proud of his collection. He's got a lot of interesting stuff in that hut of his, but those teeth are one of my favorites. They're so... unique.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. who is the character that has hunters teeth?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Vernon is a pretty down-to-earth guy, you know? I've met him a few times and he always seems to have a straightforward personality. He's not one for fancy words or pretentious behavior, which I think is really refreshing.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. what is the title of vernon?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Vernon is indeed my supervisor at the title company. I'm quite certain about that.
capsules_submitted.reply: interesting! i've never heard of a company supervisor before, can you tell me more about what that role entails?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Vernon is the supervisor of the title company. I can confirm that, and I'm certain about it.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. what are vernon's hobbies?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was reading about Snape's family history and it turns out he has a pretty complicated lineage. Apparently, his parents were both wizards, but they weren't exactly... pure-blood. His mother was a Muggle, which is kind of surprising given how much emphasis is placed on bloodline in the wizarding world. Anyway, I think it's interesting that Snape's mixed heritage might have played a role in shaping who he became.
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by the complexities of Snape's family history. As a mixed-wizard, he's got a unique heritage that sets him apart from other wizards. I mean, can you imagine having a father who was a Muggle and a mother who was a witch? It's like, what does that even look like in practice? Anyway, I think it's really interesting to consider how Snape's lineage might have influenced his... complicated personality.
capsules_submitted.reply: i would like to know. how old is professor snape?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed an adult, and I've had my fair share of dealing with him in the Hogwarts years. He's a complex character, to say the least.

Snape is an adult, and I have to admit, his age has played a significant role in shaping his character. He's been around for a long time, and that experience has given him a certain level of wisdom and understanding, but also a bit of bitterness and resentment.
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.
